title: Flood Safety Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of flood safety and preparedness measures. No hints provided - rely on your knowledge!

questions.question: Before a flood, where should you place valuables, important documents, and hazardous substances?

options.text: In a waterproof bag on the ground floor.
On an elevated surface, as high as possible.
Outside the house in a secure container.

questions.question: What should you do with doors and windows when a flood is imminent?

options.text: Keep them slightly ajar for ventilation.
Close all doors and windows and seal off all low-down gaps or openings in your home as best as you can.
Leave them open to allow water to flow through.

questions.question: What utility supplies should be turned off at the mains when a flood is imminent?
If ordered to evacuate during a flood, what action is strongly advised?

options.text: Wait for the flood to recede slightly.
Do not wait until the last moment.
Take as many belongings as possible.
Inform only emergency services of your departure.

questions.question: What should you never attempt to do during a flood, whether on foot or in a car?
What specific danger should you stay away from if it has fallen to the ground during a flood?
What is the instruction regarding school children in case of a flood during school hours?

options.text: Children should be sent home early.
They are taken care of by teachers who are trained for such events, and parents should not collect them.
They should be moved to the lowest floor for safety.

questions.question: If you are outdoors during a flood, what should you keep away from?

options.text: Rivers, rapids, or any other body of water.

questions.question: What is specifically mentioned about cars as shelters during a flood?

options.text: They are good for temporary shelter.
They can provide protection from debris.
They are safe as long as they are on high ground.

questions.question: If you are isolated during a flood, what should you do to help others find you?

note: This quiz contains 10 flood safety questions without hints, as requested. Students must rely on their knowledge to answer correctly.
